name: Old Port Quarter
economy_niches: bonded storage and re-export of imported reagents
culture_adjustments: tighter guild control over daily life and hiring
oral port-laws and captain-focused gift-exchange ritual amplified
dense dockside argot/pidgin layered on Coastal Tongues
boardinghouses and inns oriented to transient crews
practical syncretism of rites tailored to departure/arrival
constraints: very limited buildable space; vertical/overwater sprawl only
ritual services reliant on scarce imported reagents
notes: core of the state's shipbuilding/trade chain; archival records often oral
layered quays and refuse make groundworks and archaeology difficult
